file_insights.changes: Appended detailed benchmark results for E04 rolling extrema benchmarks, tracking performance of deque vs naive approaches
Updated subtask-2-4 status from 'pending' to 'completed', added detailed notes about benchmark findings and outcomes

patterns_discovered: Algorithm performance varies significantly with input size and window period
Deque-based approach has different performance characteristics compared to naive scan
Crossover point in algorithm efficiency occurs around period 50
Complexity of rolling window algorithms depends on implementation strategy
gotchas_discovered: Naive approach can be faster for small window sizes (k<50)
Deque approach introduces overhead that impacts small window performance
Performance scaling is not linear and depends on window size (period)
Benchmark results contradict initial hypotheses about algorithm efficiency

approach_outcome.recommendation: Hybrid implementation selecting algorithm based on period

recommendations: Use naive approach for small periods (k<50)
Use deque approach for large periods (k≥50)
Implement algorithm selection logic based on window size
Further optimize Welford implementation for rolling statistics
Consider memory allocation impact in benchmarking
